website_summaries.verdict: The Snapfon ezTWO is a solid no-frills phone geared toward seniors. We like its handy SOS button for emergencies, but some flaws prevent it from nabbing our Editors' Choice award for simple phones.
pros: SOS button offers quick access to emergency services
cons: Menu system could be more intuitive

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, waste of money, poor customer service> RETURNING IT
customer_reviews.text: This thing is garbage. Didn't work right out of the package. Wouldn't charge. After at least three calls, they finally sent me a new battery. Now it won't take incoming or make outgoing calls, even though it powers up, and the company is not returning my calls. It is a great idea--big buttons, loud speaker, it reads the numbers as you punch them in! BUT if it won't work, it is a huge waste of time. Also, may I ask why oh WHY the user manual is printed in tiny print? Hello? Anyone there?
customer_reviews.author: suzanne P. Benson

customer_reviews.title: This Phone Sucks
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this phone to be good, but it was a horrible failure. It worked great for the first few months but then its reception was horrific. Calls would constantly be dropped and I would constantly loose connection.The battery life only lasts for a few hours and dies very, very quickly. The text messaging is saved to capital letters so you have to continually switch to lower case letters when texting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best phone for seniors!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic phone! A gift to my 90 year old mother who lives out of state and is hearing and vision impaired. She easily got the basics and was glad to see a manual. She placed the SIM card from her old phone and was good to go. Following my suggestion, she went online to examine all of the features (a walk-thru of about 32 clearly presented little segments). This is the best phone she has ever used. Voices come over loud and clear, ringtone is loud and the size of phone and numbers are perfect, plus all of the other features not found elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Beltran

customer_reviews.title: Short life. Fitful death. Overall disposable.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone in September 2015 for use by an elderly relative. It was simple compared to most others which was a plus. For the first 6-9 months worked fine although it had intermittent charging issues. This finally escalated to its death. By the end it was only holding the charge occasionally which didn't fit the bill for an "emergency" phone. I tried different chargers, changed the battery (x2), and even reset it all to no avail. If you are looking for a short term disposable phone by all means buy it. If you need a phone for a child, senior or other person that would require reliability keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: CDS

customer_reviews.title: The best phone for old people PERIOD.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best phone for elderly folk period. It's loud as hell, the buttons (although they look like they don't light up) are unbelievably bright, the display is also extremely bright even at noon in July, and it's interface is simplified to 4 button (unlike competitors that have 8!), battery is great too. If you got a grandfather or grandmother that you love, then you should buy this phone for them. They will appreciate you for it.
customer_reviews.author: Arctic105

customer_reviews.title: Simply Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This phone was purchased for my 80+ year old mother. It has been perfect and provides the added feature of an emergency button. Construction is sturdy. Keypad locks to prevent accidental dialing. Emergency button works when keypad is locked (but the button is slightly recessed preventing unwanted activation).
customer_reviews.author: Saramedic

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Visually Impaired and Less Tech Savvy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this phone for my older aunt with vision impairment. The phone is perfect for her. I programmed the speed dials and phone book for her, but she loves the big buttons, large display screen with large text, and ease of use. She especially loves the fact that the phone audibly tells her what button she just pushed - speaks as she dials. Check snapfon's coverage map. I opted for the unlocked version for better coverage in my more rural local, but if snapfon's cellular service has coverage in your area I would recommend buying the locked version of this snapfon EZ TWO instead (~$20-30 cheaper) and go with the snapfon cellular plan.
customer_reviews.author: AndieCicc

customer_reviews.title: Great for those who are technology challenged and visually challenged
customer_reviews.text: My wife is legally blind and technology challenged. We have tried smart phones hoping the voice commands would work...but that fails to do the trick. We tried flip hones and all the rest. This phone has large illuminated buttons that are easy to see and says which button you are pushing.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Malham

customer_reviews.title: Great phone - needs a 3G SIM for best functionality
customer_reviews.text: This phone is really great for seniors that have vision and/or hearing issues. The one caveat is that it's a 3G phone and it may not function 100% with a 4G SIM card (even with a shim kit), so it's best to check with your provider and see if you can get a standard-size 3G SIM card before putting this phone in service.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff A. Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Should be called the ECHOFON
customer_reviews.text: These phones are easy to operate, but the person talking to the snapfon user hears their voice echo. Tryed turning volume down. Antenna and repeater to boost signal, still echos. Another brand of phone ( LG) does not echo under same conditions. Bought 2 of them for my elderly mother. Both echo. Very annoying!
customer_reviews.author: Janet Foxworthy

customer_reviews.title: Getting to contacts not very senior friendly
customer_reviews.text: Hi I bought this phone for my mother, the overall phone design is good as the numbers are large and the screen display is easier for her to read, however it would be a much superior product if you could program it so that they can access contacts by just hitting any button. It is very hard for her to remember that she has to press a very specific button to get to the contacts, this is not very senior friendly, that is my main pet peeve. I like that I was able to program the SOS alerts and also to send me a text if her phone battery needs charging.
customer_reviews.author: Dora Suarez

customer_reviews.title: Great phone except for the battery charge life!
customer_reviews.text: As most other reviewers have indicated ... great simple phone for seniors who shy away from technology. Simple, easy and serves the purpose of making and receiving calls. I would give the phone 5 stars if the battery charge lasted longer than 3-5 hours of talk time; what a pain! Had to buy a pocket charger for that very reason. Just because seniors need an easy to use phone doesn't mean they don't like to use the phone for more than 3 hours of calls.
customer_reviews.author: P.T.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic phone for seniors or persons with vision problems!
customer_reviews.text: My mother-in-law loves it and everyone asks here about it and how they can get it. Would definitely recommend for seniors or people who have vision problems. As you punch the keys it vocalizes the key number/label. You can even change the voice language to Spanish (maybe others also)
customer_reviews.author: Damor

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 3 hours, now dead & won't turn on at all.
customer_reviews.text: Phone worked for 3 hours last night after being fully charged. This morning it refuses to work at all,screen won't even light up. I'm 68 years old ,live alone,have heart & breathing issues, can't even phone for help .Hoping I can eventually raise someone on the Internet,serious winter storm heading in,will be hopeless if power goes out. The phone was a total waste of time & money even for the $79 price. I ended up buying a Tracfone for $14.99 and a one month phone plan for $20.,it worked perfectly first time using and continues to work perfectly 3 weeks later.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Phone not working after only 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Bought phone as Christmas gift for my 99 year old mother. When it was working, we were fairly satisfied. The phone is simple to use and the volume was much louder than the smart phone that she had before. After less than 3 weeks of use, phone cannot be powered up even though battery is charged (battery was independently tested). I am hoping I can return it or get my money back even though the box was thrown out.
customer_reviews.author: Dolcie E Chin

customer_reviews.title: Dont bother
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine for a few months and stopped working. Wont charge, wont turn on. We just got my grandma to be able to use it and now its broken. Additionally, there is no GPS so we cant find her If she does hit the sos button.
customer_reviews.author: A. Barron

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. The sound is nice and loud for my mom and the phone is easy to use. We discovered a glitch with the flashlight function. If the flashlight is on when she makes a call it mutes the call on both ends. I don't know if this is a defect with her phone or with the model. So, if you're having this problem with calls make sure the flashlight is off. It's very easy to turn the flashlight on be accident. We called customer service and they were very nice and answered the call right away. They were unable to fix the problem though. We discovered the fix quite by accident.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall a great Phone for Seniors.
customer_reviews.text: Good: a- Price b- Size c- Easy to Operate, big Keys, nice screen, good emergency programmable button d- Battery ( amazing 5 days on stand by), you must buy the charging Craddle, My Mom loves it, there's no need to find chargers or connect cables, just leave the craddle connected to the charger and Voila!! Not to Good: a- cheap plastic ( fair for the price) b- speaker (could be better)
customer_reviews.author: Carlos A. Bianconi

customer_reviews.title: Does what it said it would
customer_reviews.text: A good phone for seniors or someone who cannot remember all the things they need to know to operate a "smart phone". A good phone for making and receiving calls. The "SOS" button is a plus and actually works. A good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: which I love. However
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a follow-on to my 'Just 5' large button phone. I haven't used it yet, since AT&T still supports the Just 5, which I love. However, they will cut it off, deleting Gen 2 service on Dec 31, 2016. The ezTWO has a larger screen (which I don't care for) and smaller buttons which is a shame too, but I guess some people prefer this. Oh well, at least the ezTWO will work on a Gen 3 network after Dec 31. I also have all text service turned off and prefer not to have a voice mailbox. This is to be a reliable mobile telephone, not a gadget or a toy.
customer_reviews.author: thuddriver

customer_reviews.title: Good for elderly but it has limitations.
customer_reviews.text: Great for seniors with vision impairment and arthritis. Can program to text more than 1 person then call in an emergency. The only downside is if it reaches an voicemail it thinks it's a person and won't call the next person in line.
customer_reviews.author: sarge

customer_reviews.title: Perfect phone for seniors but couldn't manage to configure the GPS mode.
customer_reviews.text: Phone works perfect with Costa Rica phone providers the only thing i couldn't manage to configure is the S.O.S buttom with the GPS. Message is sent to the person i added but the location is not populated, not sure if this feature only works on the US. And yeah, it sounds very loud even with the minimum volume and would be nice to have a button to put it on vibrate or silent mode. What i like is that it comes with 3G and most phones for seniors works only on 2G and with that the coverage of signal is very bad and this phone works perfect on most locations in this country.
customer_reviews.author: madmax

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: We have 4 cell phones on our plan. The other 3 work fine (smart phones) and then there is this one. Grandad wanted a simple phone that he could use, so we got him this one. It has never worked right. I thought it was an operator problem till I traded him phones for a wile. It constantly drops calls, it will ring and you answer you can't hear the person on the other end, or they can't hear you. the volume goes up and down during a call. Lots of times it says no service.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Dialing is easy for her and it has been a blessing to ...
customer_reviews.text: My elderly grandma can use this phone. What a blessing she can hear and be heard. Dialing is easy for her and it has been a blessing to find a simple phone with loudness enough both on the ringing and the call volume. Good battery life so far, and for what is available this is wonderful. The guy at the AT&T store (where I went to get a SIM card) set it up for me and somehow locked her out of the controls and the buttons on the side. Great!!!
customer_reviews.author: April Seward

customer_reviews.title: Good phone depending on how able your "Senior" is
customer_reviews.text: It's better than most out there that I could find (for my mother). I do think it could be even more "Senior" friendly, as she wasn't able to use it well enough to rely on. For those who have trouble with tv remotes (all you caretakers know what I'm talking about lol) this phone is better but still not as simple as could be. Unless something new is out there, this is the simplest so far though.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Device Soon  Obsolete
customer_reviews.text: This is.a 3G device that I find will be useless soon with ATT, Verizon, and other major service providers. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Spradlin

customer_reviews.title: Simple/Easy Phone for Seniors
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a relative who just transitioned into a Senior assisted living facility. No connectivity to confuse or bleed battery life. Large keys & easy to read display. Easy use flashlight via side button. Large red emergency contact button on back of phone that also rings an alert sound. Essentially 3G technology so make your the SIM-Card is compatible with cellular carrier.
customer_reviews.author: JamesSt.

customer_reviews.title: Not good for a senior who has never used a cell phone and has memory problems
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with this phone but my 83-yo mom has lots of problems with it. She simply forgets the functionality, either unable to place a call when necessary or placing SOS calls by accident. She also has a problem holding the hang-up button too long, thereby completely powering it off. Lastly, there is no functionality to block calls, which she needs because 75% of calls are telemarketers. Sadly I’m going to swap this out with an old iPhone so can tell Siri who she wants to call instead of placing accidental incorrect calls.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Barely 6 months old and it will not hold a charge. It's difficult to use for a senior citizen. Can I get my refund if it's returned? Where can I find more information on this? I'm very disappointed. It's unusable because you cannot make any calls with the charger attached. What if it's a true emergency????
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Croitoru

customer_reviews.title: Did not work with Sprint service
customer_reviews.text: Love this phone for mother in law, but had to return because the sim card doesn't match up with Sprint services. We did purchase directly from company and used company's cell service and happy with that. Return was easy. REPEAT - ALL SIM CARDS DO NOT WORK WITH THIS PHONE. VISIT WEBSITE.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for elderly
customer_reviews.text: Bought this phone for my 85 year old father who was having difficulty using his cell phone which was small with very small keypad and too many unnecessary buttons. I had never bought a phone other than from our carrier, so wasn't sure I could set it up to work, but it was incredibly easy! Just took SIM card out of his old phone and slid it into this one. Voila, working phone! Didn't have to change carriers or worry about reception of alternative company, etc. Easy to program and just super simple to use! He has problems learning anything new but got onto this phone very quickly. I highly recommend this phone for the older senior citizen!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Lobb

customer_reviews.title: Best senior phone
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I purchased this phone for my mother-in-law it seem the first one lasted over 2 years and may have Fail do to drop or constant use every single day for 4 hours a day I still believe is the Best phone for any adult easy to use great features like the emergency dial with up to 5 number and open microphone and speaker when numbered are press it call out the number as well look no further for a phone for an adult this is it. This is my second review still a great phone and very simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: G. Mirabal

customer_reviews.title: It holds easily in a medium size hand
customer_reviews.text: Before I even write this review I just bought a second one. The phone is as described, designed for the elderly. It holds easily in a medium size hand. The buttons are soft to the touch and the display is big enough for a low vision person to read. The flashlight, activated by sliding a button on the side, is a bonus. You don't need to be savvy to personalize the settings. Overall I am highly satisfied and so do my relatives I bought it for.I would not hesitate to recommend it or to purchase it again
customer_reviews.author: Roro

customer_reviews.title: It is very easy for a senior to operate
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Father who is 87 yrs old. My mother just passed and he is by himself. It is very easy for a senior to operate,plus the security of a panic button if he gets in trouble. The only thing I wish it came with a easy to open attachable belt case.Love the big buttons and calls out the numbers dialed. I am now at ease knowing he can operate this easy phone. A must if you have elderly parent who is not "TECH Savy"
customer_reviews.author: Bobbi Jo B.

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, I bought this for my elderly dad ...
customer_reviews.text: Great phone, I bought this for my elderly dad who has visual and hearing challenges and he loves it. Very good price, very good product, seems to be very well made and the folks at AT&T really liked it too. Update He is currently on his Third Snapfon not because of the quality by any means, but because he's lost them. Bottom line, the one he's using now is still great, reliable and dependable.
customer_reviews.author: J. Naeve

customer_reviews.title: Great value, quality, and features.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 72 year old disabled vet friend that only has one arm. I have tried at least 6 different cell phones for him. This is the first one that he has felt comfortable with and uses regularly. It is sturdy and has just the right number of features like stored numbers, emergency number dialing. Now if I can figure out how I get him not to call me at 5AM it would be perfect for me also! He loves the phone, and I found it a great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: snowflashdrop

customer_reviews.title: Great for senior use!
customer_reviews.text: My mother is 90. I have tried smart phones but it’s too confusing. She just needs is to call and get calls on the phone. I just put her AT&T and programed her numbers and SOS! Perfect. And simple! I got a case because she needs a good grip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good & simple phone for elderly but only allows 250 address book/contact entries!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Good & simple phone for elderly but only allows 250 address book/contact entries!!!! Its 2015, the phone should have a little more memory for that or, because it supports external micro sd card, it should allow to save contacts on the sd card thus giving unlimited entries. This was a Christmas gift for my grandpa & he's over the years, amassed quite a long address book. Trying to sort & filter those addresses so that they don't exceed the 250mark is so much work for him it is just easier & convenient if he doesn't have to worry about that.
customer_reviews.author: Mangi

customer_reviews.title: Ok phone...
customer_reviews.text: Ok phone my mom likes it good emergency feature. Sub par battery life.
customer_reviews.author: jealm

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC PHONE FOR ELDERLY PEOPLE!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My Dad cannot stop thanking me enough for purchasing this phone for himself AND my Mother. It's so easy to use and has lots of features. My Dad cannot see very well , Macular degeneration and the buttons are pretty large to accommodate his failing eyesight. My Mother has dementia and forgets how to use the - one button speed dial but at least she can use this phone when she remembers the number. The people at SnapFon are wonderful if you need help!
customer_reviews.author: Sherr

customer_reviews.title: Died after one month of service
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably happy with this phone with a couple of significant exceptions. First, it's construction is very flimsy. It feels very cheap in your hand. Second, all the ring tones (actually all audio sounds) are much too loud -- even at their lowest volume settings. Perhaps this is by design for seniors, but there are some of us who don't want the whole neighborhood to be alerted to our incoming calls. UPDATE - 12/01/2015: No longer happy with this phone. After one month of service it died.
customer_reviews.author: Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Phone lasted 5 months.  Customer Service does not respond to emails or calls.
customer_reviews.text: I bought phone new 5 months ago. From the 1st day, anyone on the receiving end of a phone call made from this phone has a hard time hearing users voice. Basically it sounds like you are far away even when yelling. I put up with it because I liked the big numbers and screen. Then a week ago the phone stopped taking a charge. I tried calling and emailing customer service multiple times... No Reply.
customer_reviews.author: liquid

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend for anyone who is hard of hearing
customer_reviews.text: As described. My mom loves it. Loud and clear conversations. Can make tones very loud if needed. Still need to review the various help videos to finish setting up. Would definitely recommend for anyone who is hard of hearing, sight impaired, or smartphone challenged. If text a lot, this is a throwback to the Blackberry keyboard days, so be warned.
customer_reviews.author: 3inbowie

customer_reviews.title: Love this phone! Excellent for Seniors!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone for my 87 year old mother who was having trouble with an old flip phone. She used the flip phone by choice since she could not handle the newer touch screen cells, but the flip phone had very small punch keys. She has had the Snapfon ezTwo for about a month now and she loves it! She reports that it is easy to use with large numbers. Also, she can hear callers a lot better. We love that we will also be able to program it to let us know via call & text if there is an emergency and also when it needs charging.
customer_reviews.author: H-Linda

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone
customer_reviews.text: My 95 year old mother loves this phone. It is easy to use, has a long battery life and big buttons. T-Mobile is where you have to go to activate the phone. They may tell you they do not do it but they do.
customer_reviews.author: LindyBear23

customer_reviews.title: Still too complicated for the elderly
customer_reviews.text: Great little phone. Good volume and the numbers are large and easy to read. For my 89 year old elderly friend, it is still too complicated and the slide controls on the side of the phone are constantly getting moved to the wrong position. The "phone book" feature is far too complicated for an elderly person to use. I had to write detailed directions so my friend could access the contact list in the phone to dial the number automatically. I would recommend this phone, but it still needs to be more simplified for the elderly. The company should consider two models, one for seniors and one for the elderly.
customer_reviews.author: David H. Scott

customer_reviews.title: More simple than most phones, but still a bit too complicated
customer_reviews.text: The phone is meant for non-techy seniors, but I think there is too much data on the screen for them. They dont really need the bars and stats - just the time. Also, I expected they could just press the arrow and get the list of names, but they have to press one of the side bars (menu or options) before they can use the arrows. All in all, I think it could have been made more simple. My mom is having trouble with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the older set.
customer_reviews.text: We are an older couple and the phone works for us just great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good phone for seniors, specially with vision problems
customer_reviews.text: Big buttons, big letters/numbers on screen, pretty loud. Nice feature - speaking keyboard. Works on AT&T network. One drawback - keyboard locking switch is "flimsy". I'm not sure if it survive long enough.
customer_reviews.author: netplumber

customer_reviews.title: SOS Alert doesn't do what it says it will do!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone from my elderly father for it's basic and easy use and for the SOS feature. The description and the MANUAL says when you press the alert, your designated call list will get a text and voice message call. I tested this out... it won't make the voice call unless you have text message enabled. My dad doesn't have text service because he doesn't nkow how to text and there's no need to pay for this extra service. They should be clear in their instructions and descrription that you need text capability in order to use the SOS feature... not either/or!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 84 year old mother. Lasted 3 months and then she could hear anyone anymore!! I tries everything I could think of to fix it. Nothing worked. The return window had closed. Junk.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bocanegra

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone for my 81 Year old Dad. The screen is easy to see and the numbers are nice and Big. The language can be changed to Spanish. The inclusion of a Camera and LED Flashlight is a mixed blessing. I don't see my Dad using them and he gets confused as to what button does what. A more technically inclined Senior may find this two additions helpful. The volume is good and ringtones loud. I wish I could remove the buttons for the Camera and LED light to avoid this confusion. An option to install custom ringtones would be nice but overall I have no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: GusD

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Was really happy with the phone for my senior parent. The phone had loud ringer, large display, physical size of phone was easily manageable. Easy to say this in the advertising, was pleased it see it exceeded my expectation. The retro usage of a lanyard tie point is great for seniors. I would give it 5 stars except for the flashlight fault. The flash light is great, but should include some type of time out feature cause it's easily turned on by accident and can run the battery down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this phone
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this phone. I purchased it for my husband who had a difficult time with the tiny buttons on his old phone. The buttons on this phone are much easier to manipulate. Also, the emergency button on the back is a great added feature - I have it programmed to send the text to me, so he can press that and I call him back. It was very simple to set up - just took the SIM card from the old AT&T phone and placed it in the Snapfon and we were ready to go. The features are very easy to use as well. Great phone for seniors who need a good, simple phone.
customer_reviews.author: Lulu

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good.........
customer_reviews.text: For the most part I'm impressed. I don't see how the over all functioning can be improved upon. The only obvious shortcoming is with the materials it's made of. As is it should retail for $50. or better yet use polycarbonate and gorilla glass, not low quality painted plastic. It would seem there is a huge untapped market for this kind of phone so maybe this is only the beginning. It might need to be simplified even further for the elderly but for those like myself who are just burned out on the endless complexity of technology this is sweet.
customer_reviews.author: James Zelenka

customer_reviews.title: Poor connection
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone for my elderly parent. The features are simple, good size phone with large buttons, nothing complicated. What good is all that if she can't make or receive a call? Poor and intermittent reception in the city, we live in Denver not in a cornfield off grid. It's too bad the box was thrown out or this would've been returned within a week of testing it. Even the old flip phone from 2013 performed far superior than this Snapfone. Don't waste your money or hold on to the box for return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My brother in law says that it sounds so much better than her previous simple flip phone (which she could ...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this phone for my 83 year old mother in law. It works just as described, and she has no issues with it. My brother in law says that it sounds so much better than her previous simple flip phone (which she could no longer use because of arthritis) that he has to ask her to turn down the volume of the television now when he calls her! Perfect answer to a non-smart phone/non-flip phone choice.
customer_reviews.author: Homer D Caine III

customer_reviews.title: This phone was a tremendous disappointment. I bought it for my elderly mother and ...
customer_reviews.text: This phone was a tremendous disappointment. I bought it for my elderly mother and it was anything but elder-friendly. My mother kept inadvertently hitting the volume button on the side of the phone (it was hard not to hit it) thereby lowering the volume. I therefore couldn't reach her, as the volume was completely lowered! After owning it for two weeks the phone fell onto s carpeted floor and lost half of the screen. Not happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kaily

customer_reviews.title: Snapfon and a 99 year old.
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased the Snapfon for my 99 year old mother, who has both hearing and vision issues. In about two weeks of regular use and coaching, she is getting used to the phone and actually likes it. She uses it daily to call friends and relatives. The only problem encountered so far is an accidental 911 call. She accidentally pressed the alarm button when showing the phone to friend. 911 operator was understanding, so no problem. Excellent phone and works just as advertised. Only suggestion would be to double the size of the phone to increase the size of the screen and buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic phone at good price, for the right user.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone for an elderly family member who didn't have the need for, or patience to learn how to operate, a more advanced, feature laden mobile phone. I am happy to report it has been a good fit, with no complaints to date. The phone is almost intuitive in its simplicity to use, and the buttons are over-sized for arthritic joints or poor eyesight. Also, the ringer volume is adjustable to a higher volume level that what is usually found on standard cell phones, and it is hearing aid compatible. If you or a loved one have any of these concerns, this is absolutely the right phone for you!
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: The phone is ultra tough and extremely easy to use before this my grandmother had a regular ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my first one of these about 3 years ago for my 93 year old grandmother. The phone is ultra tough and extremely easy to use before this my grandmother had a regular basic phone, you can never understand how to use it. With this phone she called us all day long and feels extremely comfortable anywhere she is because she knows she can get in contact with somebody. My grandma knows nothing about electronics, but with this she feels like she's all sorts of up-to-date in electronics. She never goes anywhere without this phone.
customer_reviews.author: nathan

customer_reviews.title: Nice phone for my grandma!!!
customer_reviews.text: Up to this moment this purchase has been very good since the phone is used mostly by my grandmother. Currently she has not experienced any problems with it. Before this purchase me and my mother had several problems trying to get a phone for elder people to use easily since here in Costa Rica there are a few stores that offered this type of devices. Fortunately after doing a little research I was able to locate this phone that offer very easy instructions in order to use it as soon as you take it out from the box. Overall a good purchase. Hope to get another phone in a near future!!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Adolio Cascante

customer_reviews.title: Poor design and not senior friendly
customer_reviews.text: The phone has an issue with turning off by itself whenever set down too hard. If the phone is dropped from greater than 1/2" above a surface the phone turns off. We bought this phone for a family member living in an assisted living community and couldn't figure out why all of our calls were going directly to voicemail. It turns our the phone was shutting itself off every time she sat the phone on her coffee table.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for low vision people
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone for my husband who has low vision. He loves it with all it's features especially the large numbers. We were surprised that it also features a camera. It is compatable with AT&T and the AT&T rep who helped us set up our phone program was very impressed with the phone. Before I purchased the Snapfon ez Two Senior Unlocked GSM Cell Phone we talked to At&T and asked what phone they could offer for the needs my husband wanted. The nearest phone was a smart phone but all those "bells and whistles" is not what he wanted. I would highly recommended this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L. Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Great for mom
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be working great for my 88 year old mom. Got it over paying for her to have long distance added to her phone line. Just added her to our plan and she is back in touch with those out of state.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy to see button
customer_reviews.text: Easier to see buttons than most cell phones - not worried about the advanced features so I am not going to attempt to review those, but the buttons are easy to see and seem pretty intuitive
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Birmingham

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money, too light to hold up to normal use
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy, cheap material, my elderly father broke it quite easily within a couple of weeks. Wished I had spent the extra money and got the insurance. Now I have a $70 flashlight....the case is sold separate, a thin, slippery, plastic case, not worth the bother, no less slippery than the phone itself. Would not recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Rainkatt

customer_reviews.title: Great phone!
customer_reviews.text: Hated having to be in the position of NEEDING a phone with big buttons, but I was, so research everything I could for "big button phones"- and since T-Mobile had nothing to compare,I got this one. It's totally just what I needed! And the sound is terrific, I like the way it lights up...love the flashlight feature, the sound choices (I use theme from the Andy Griffith show)....It's just perfect! And using it with my T-Mobile server was no problem either.In fact, T-mobile could learn something from the Snafone folks....not everyone who needs a cell phone has great eyesight!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn J. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Good for us stoneagers!!
customer_reviews.text: Having had to make a long road trip, I didn't want to worry about making or getting phone calls while driving. This Snapfon ezOne was great. It does what it says, the numbers are large and lighted, and all the features worked well. I only had one complaint, and that is with the instructions. I like them to tell me how to do anything teckie with the attitude that this person needs the most inane and simple steps. The companies could make them with all pix or really as simple as humanely possible, then I could follow them. Still felt a little stupid trying to follow instuctions provided, but that's me.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen E. Stapleton

customer_reviews.title: Don’t purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone for my mom in May of 2019 and in less than a year the phone no longer works. It worked one day and the next day it refuses to charge up. Also this phone was suppose to be elderly friendly, yet at my age I didn’t find it user friendly
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Jones

customer_reviews.title: My parents love it!
customer_reviews.text: My parents love the large numbers and screen. It is light. The only thing they don't like is the length of the ringer, but it might be a setting thing I need to adjust for them. Great simple phone.
customer_reviews.author: Sallyz

customer_reviews.title: Great for seniors - screen broke.
customer_reviews.text: I like this phone a lot - it is easy for my senior parents to use and loud enough that they can hear it. However, the screen broke about a month after we got it. I'm hoping by posting this the manufacturer will send a replacement or refund $$. The first one we bought lasted for years.
customer_reviews.author: Emily L. Koechel

customer_reviews.title: Poor speakerphone sound broken USB port
customer_reviews.text: Phone arrived with a partial battery charge and when I turn it on I noticed that the speakerphone was too weak for my mom to hear and then when I went to charge it I noticed it had a broken USB port and was unable to charge the device so I returned it for a refund
customer_reviews.author: ivan de Prume

customer_reviews.title: Great for what it is
customer_reviews.text: So far this has been the berries for my elderly father-in-law. He's 96 and the large buttons on this phone are the best we've found for his huge fingers. However, we hear from AT&T that he won't be able to use this phone in the near future, as it won't be compatible with them. So we'll be looking again.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, but bad sound quality
customer_reviews.text: My dad likes this phone and says it's easy to use (he is both hearing and vision impaired). He wanted old-school speed dial so he could avoid scrolling through a contact list, and this phone has it. Unfortunately, when I have spoken to him from my cell phone, the sound quality has been terrible. I have to strain to understand him (and I am not hearing impaired). It seems good for emergencies or occasional use but maybe not for long conversations.
customer_reviews.author: Starling

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: AT&T stated that the Snapfon EZ2 3G was not able to be used on the AT&T system regardless of what sim card is used because it is a 2G device, and as such was not able to be set up to work on the AT&T system. I spent nearly 4 hours at the AT&T store and got nothing done. I don't know where the problem lies, AT&T, Snap-fon, Amazon or me for trusting any of them; bottom line is it dosen't work, I'm out over $100.00 & Mom does not have a phone. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: that guy

customer_reviews.title: Great Senior Phone
customer_reviews.text: This was bought for my Dad. He loves it. Now if we could find a way it did not end in water.
customer_reviews.author: Debra T.

customer_reviews.title: Not very helpful for a. person that is blind
customer_reviews.text: Not too bad of a phone. I noticed the phone is more helpful for a person that is deaf not so much for a person that is blind. It will repeat the numbers that are pressed but upon receiving a call it will not speak who is calling on caller ID. I really need that feature
customer_reviews.author: Butterfly

customer_reviews.title: Just what my 89 year old mom needed
customer_reviews.text: We struggled with several flip phones when her old Track One phone died. I was able to explain this one in 5 minutes and she was up and running using it. Very easy and intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: Scooby-Doo

customer_reviews.title: It's easy for her to see numbers and use to call ...
customer_reviews.text: For our 94 year old Mother. Got this model to replace the older version of the same phone. It's easy for her to see numbers and use to call and see who's called her, but she still has no clue how to retrieve messages or use some of the other functions. Still, it's the best phone for someone like her, and is recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ( DISAPPOINTED with this buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought couple of these phones for my elder parents in India. From day one. my parents reported me of callers complaining them of not being able to hear them properly. Apparently, mic is not working properly. Since I have also moved to India and I am unable to return these phones :( DISAPPOINTED with this buy.
customer_reviews.author: Ravichandran M.

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made. After less than six months the port won’t hold the charge plug. It would cost more to fix than the phone is worth. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Maner

customer_reviews.title: Basic and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Phone is for my 95 year old mother. Phone is cheaply made, but does have big buttons and loud volume. Very basic and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy West

customer_reviews.title: This phone works so much better for me
customer_reviews.text: I got this phone because I have problems with my hearing , seeing and hands. My other two cellphones I can,t dial (buttons too small) and can't hear on. This phone works so much better for me. I have multiple sclerosis and this phone is a blessing. The customer service was quick to respond and very helpful. I was really impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Electflow

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality - stopped working after 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: It's been quirky from the beginning, but now - just 2 months since purchase - it rarely connects. Poor quality construction is my guess, but Amazon says its beyond the return policy. Sad, because it's the right size/functionality for seniors but if it's not dependable its not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: M. King

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for seniors
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this phone for my husband's elderly parents & was pleased to find that the glowing reviews of this product were accurate. The parents appreciate the talking keys function, as well as large buttons & display. They also appreciate the simple menu the phone has; they didn't want anything too complicated. The only thing I would improve would be a slightly more detailed instruction manual, but the one that comes with the phone is adequate for anyone familiar with computers. I highly recommend this phone, especially at the very reasonable price I got it at.
customer_reviews.author: K. Vancura

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for seniors
customer_reviews.text: My husband has AT&T service and this phone works with it. Large screen and large numbers. Easy to operate
customer_reviews.author: Melva Anderson

customer_reviews.title: 2G phone.  Unable to activate on ATT.
customer_reviews.text: I was unable to activate the Snap-On ezTWO3G phone on ATT. As soon as I gave the ATT person the IMEI number he identified it as a 2G phone. ATT will no longer att 2G accounts. One prior reviewer reported this 2G problem but I thought that was for the older version of this phone. Apparently not. The 3G in the title of the product name appears deceptive. I am returning the phone less than 4 hours after opening the box, after wasting substantial time trying to get it activated.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell R

customer_reviews.title: Terrible!
customer_reviews.text: Worked one month, battery have low duration, suddenly screen doesn't work anymore.
customer_reviews.author: GABRIEL OSWALDO DUQUE ZULUAGA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Mom!
customer_reviews.text: My Mom is 79 years old and has struggled with cell phones for a while now. The models I have bought her were supposed to be the easy to use ones, but have been so complicated she can't use them. I searched the internet for the easiest phone for seniors, and this is the model that consistently appeared, so I ordered one! I was thrilled, and so was she! It is easy to use, easy to see, easy to dial without hitting the wrong button, easy for her to hear the conversations - everything about it was a win! And compatible with our AT&T service! Highly recommend this phone for anyone wanting the best phone possible for an elderly user!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia C. Stem

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for technically challenged
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this phone for my mom who had lots of problems using other phones. This has been very easy for her to understand and use. Larger numbers really help. Many other features nice for older people.
customer_reviews.author: marilyn kay boatman

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 85 year old dad. It was easy to set-up and use. Problem is it is there seems to be something wrong with the phone's microphone. On a call he can hear me, but it's very hard to understand him. I've tried troubleshooting - how he holds the phone, etc, but it's hard to help from 2000 miles away. There are a couple reviews that mention the same problem. Considering that the only expectation for this phone was that it makes calls, this is a fail.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: ... the basic functions but it seems to be working fine for my 87 year old father
customer_reviews.text: We just use the basic functions but it seems to be working fine for my 87 year old father. I needed to find a 3G AT&T compatible phone he could hold in his arthritic hand and easily dial my number (programmed key). This phone, along with a case to make it less slippery to hold, seems to do the trick! We took it into our local AT&T store to have his phone number transferred to the new phone and all is good.
customer_reviews.author: dj.124

customer_reviews.title: Poor phone
customer_reviews.text: Terrible phone. Large buttons and good high volume for the hard of hearing when the phone is working. It often gets into a "stuck mode" where you are not able to answer or make calls. Currently my father is able to receive calls but you are not able to hear what he is saying at the other end. Would not buy again. Now I have to purchase another phone because I can no longer return it. I bought it in April 2015.
customer_reviews.author: Maria C. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Good phone
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this phone for my 68 year old Mother. She needed something simple to use with large numbers. This phone fits the bill. She can see the numbers and there are not a lot of options to confuse her. The only thing I would change is the ability to remove 911 from the Browse contact feature. Since it is the first one on the list, she has accidentally call 911 a couple of times. Other than that, good phone. Works well with Straight Talk phone plan also.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wooster

customer_reviews.title: 90 year old senior
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Snapfon because it offers a combination of phone and medical alert. My Dad is out and about so we needed something usable anywhere rather than standard function that only works within the range of the base module. . The keys are large and the phone works well with his hearing aids. We have tested the alarm and the phone sends text messages to family members when the alarm button is pressed. The only problem so far is that the volume button (on the side of the phone) can be turned down inadvertently when placing the phone in a holder.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Excellent  phone for anyone not wanting "high tech".
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone for my husband who has difficulty using a small key pad. It is very easy to set up and use. The instruction manual is in large print and simple to follow. I did call Snapfon with a question and they gave me the information quickly and in an understandable manner. This phone would be good for anyone who does not need all the bells and whistles. While it is designed for a "senior", I think it would also be good for a young child or a developmentally disabled person.
customer_reviews.author: iigor

customer_reviews.title: THE SNAPFON PHONE IS OK  WOULD NOT BUY AGAIN
customer_reviews.text: I bought two Snapfons and had them shipped to my mother in Florida for use in Jamaica, WI. She was going on vacation and one phone was for someone living there. She used it but enjoyed the radio and light most of all. I bought one for myself. The reception was very bad, weak. I had trouble hearing communicating on it. It was nice to have the radio and light, but I would prefer to phone to have worked.... My friends phone fell apart, buttons started falling off and just stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Gang

customer_reviews.title: This one works!
customer_reviews.text: I searched for a cell phone many times over the years. All failed me, mostly because I couldn't hear what was being said, at least not clearly. This phone works just as well as advertised. I am absolutely ecstatic! I can even hear without my hearing aid and I have severe loss in the ear I use. If you need a cell phone and have a hearing loss this is the one to get. All the other factors are as advertised and are terrific bonuses for me. I have no connection with the company. However I just had to write this review. Linda B
customer_reviews.author: linda alexiata blazonis

customer_reviews.title: ... at first and my 99 year old grand dad loved it, but after a few months
customer_reviews.text: The phone worked at first and my 99 year old grand dad loved it, but after a few months, it became defective, the volume didn't work or got stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Ford

product_meta.title: Snapfon ezTWO Senior Unlocked GSM Cell Phone, SOS Button, Hearing Aid Compatible
feature_bullets: Easy to Use Features: Speaking Keypad, Keypad Lock Side Switch, Enhanced Volume, High Power LED Flashlight, Low Battery Warning System, 8 Speed Dial Keys, Simplified Menus, 4 Alarm Modes, Hearing Aid Compatible(M3/T3)
Talk time 3-5 hours,Standby 90-120 hours. No accidental dialing with lock/unlock keypad switch.
SOS button is a senior cell phone must, with one touch play Loud 120dB Siren and connection through text and call to emergency contacts and services.

Add sosPlus Mobile Monitoring Service add to any plan and SOS button will connect you to our 24/7 Mobile Response Agents. Our operators will have your preprogramed urgent care information on hand in case of an emergency 24 hours a day, and will stay on the line with you until your emergency is resolved.

Snapfon Mobile service plans are a monthly, no-contract, budget friendly choice, or this unlocked ezTwo 3G is compatible with other SIM card carriers (ATT, T-Mobile, etc.). NOT compatible with Verizon or Sprint. GSM 850/900/1800/1900 mHz.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars1,425 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
